iPad Pro 12.9 2020 iOS 14

I was on a mission and it bugged out on the decode screen. It zoomed in on the red control panel, but the decode puzzle did not pop up. Had to kill app.

The reason for the rating is the mention of "no pay-to-win guaranteed". Which is debatable. I just imagine an overweight car salesman with a cowboy hat, spouting "gaurownteeed!" through a mouth full of dip. 

Anyway, I'm a level 27, over 3 million fame. Missions are great, fun, and occasionally challenging. Unless they crash, then you‚Äôre stuck. Sometimes multiple missions crash and you can‚Äôt get them off the itinerary unless completed. So you‚Äôre left with war games.

Playing PVP makes apparent that this may be pay-to-win. Those who are willing to pay coincidently possess superior gear, regardless of fame. I‚Äôve seen level 20‚Äôs decked out torso to toe in basilisk with insane perks under expensive skin and paint. Their armor and guns have the best perks on top of better static perks. I inspect the players post-game: 480,000 fame? Did I take the long route? I‚Äôm all for admitting I may have not grasped the level/fame aspect of the game but, c‚Äômon man.

You're allowed 15 gold a day, an ad for each. Frequently, I watch the ads, they crash, spend my opportunity and I don‚Äôt receive the gold. It happens with daily spins too. Most of the upgrades/ customizations are in the 1000's of gold. You're looking at about 4 and a half months of 3 ads a day to get a cool helmet. Unless you try to free up storage by spending gold on a strongbox, then you're probably looking at a couple years before you get anywhere. For the spins, you‚Äôll have no trouble covering everything in ‚Äúmoonlight lilac‚Äù.

The other ‚Äúfree‚Äù gold is pursued through actions (switching car insurance, etc). Some were advertised as ‚Äúsurveys‚Äù of which I have completed a few. I‚Äôve yet to receive any amount gold for the surveys. Waste of time.

One might easily avoid all this inconvenience  by dropping some $$. I assume this happens often as many of the players have multiple expensive skins, exclusively available for high amounts of gold. Which is coincidentally followed by incredible armor and weapons.

The bugs in the game are frequent in my experience. They offered a legendary item for completing a "nine codes" event for a bit of  "worth-while" equipment. Imagine spending a few hours completing a few of the missions only to have several missions/maps seize up. Time spent with no advertised payoff. Again, waste of time.

I would appreciate the game more if they didn't screw over the people who aren‚Äôt in a position to pay. After all, they have that "no pay-to-win guaranteed" posted in their description.

Just remove the false advertising and I'll throw in 2 more stars for the otherwise awesome everything.

I‚Äôve played this game for a while, and it‚Äôs what I always DREAMED of having on mobile. The gameplay is fun, the graphics are amazing, and it plays a lot like destiny! However, it‚Äôs run into the SAME PROBLEM that D1 had at launch. Once you complete the campaign and the dungeons, there‚Äôs not much else to keep players engaged. I feel like the devs could have added in a few more activities over the years, and that would definitely keep players coming back for more. Overall, an amazing game, and I‚Äôd highly recommend playing it.
